cases.title: Suspicious Lateral Movement Detected
cases.description: Multiple authentication attempts detected across network segments, indicating possible lateral movement by compromised account. Initial detection shows abnormal SMB traffic patterns and multiple failed login attempts.

activities.description: Initial triage completed. Identified source account: jsmith@corp.local. Account shows activity from multiple IPs.
Reviewed authentication logs. Found 47 failed login attempts followed by 3 successful authentications to servers in different VLANs.
Disabled compromised account jsmith@corp.local in Active Directory. Contacted user to verify recent activity.
User confirmed they did not perform these actions. Account credentials likely compromised. Reviewing EDR logs on accessed systems.
Added related findings showing suspicious process execution on target servers.
All affected systems cleaned and returned to service. Enhanced monitoring deployed. User password reset with MFA enabled.

resolution_steps.action_taken: Immediately disabled the compromised account jsmith@corp.local in Active Directory. Terminated all active sessions associated with the account across the network. Notified user via phone to verify legitimate activity.
resolution_steps.result: Account successfully disabled within 5 minutes of detection. All active sessions terminated. User confirmed suspicious activity. No legitimate business impact.

resolution_steps.action_taken: Collected authentication logs from domain controllers spanning past 7 days. Captured EDR logs from 5 accessed servers. Exported firewall logs showing network connections. Created forensic snapshots of 2 most-impacted servers (SRV-2024-042, SRV-2024-089).
resolution_steps.result: Successfully collected 12GB of log data. Identified attack timeline from initial compromise to detection. Found evidence of credential dumping tool execution on workstation WS-2024-156.

resolution_steps.action_taken: Analyzed network traffic patterns using SIEM correlation rules. Identified 5 compromised systems accessed via SMB and RDP. Reviewed process execution logs on each system. Identified malicious binary 'svchost32.exe' (mimicking legitimate process) running on 3 systems.
resolution_steps.result: Confirmed attacker accessed 5 systems total. Stole credentials from LSASS memory on 2 systems. Attempted to access file shares containing sensitive data. No evidence of successful data exfiltration detected.

resolution_steps.action_taken: Isolated affected systems from network. Killed malicious processes. Removed persistence mechanisms (scheduled tasks, registry keys). Cleared cached credentials. Applied security patches. Reimaged 2 most-compromised systems. Reset passwords for 15 accounts that authenticated to compromised systems.
resolution_steps.result: All malicious artifacts removed. No persistence mechanisms remaining. All affected systems cleaned and validated. 15 user accounts secured with password resets. Systems returned to production after 48-hour monitoring period with no suspicious activity.

resolution_steps.action_taken: Deployed enhanced EDR detection rules for credential dumping tools. Enabled MFA for all accounts in affected department. Created network monitoring rules for unusual SMB/RDP patterns. Added IOCs to threat intelligence feeds (file hashes, C2 domains). Scheduled follow-up security awareness training.
resolution_steps.result: Enhanced detection rules deployed and validated. MFA enabled for 87 users. Monitoring rules detecting similar patterns in real-time. IOCs distributed to all security tools. Training scheduled for next week.

resolution_steps.action_taken: Generated comprehensive incident report including timeline, affected systems, IOCs, and remediation steps. Created MITRE ATT&CK mapping (T1078 - Valid Accounts, T1021 - Remote Services, T1003 - Credential Dumping). Updated incident response playbook with lessons learned. Notified management and compliance team.
resolution_steps.result: Complete incident documentation created and archived. MITRE mapping completed for threat intelligence. Playbook updated with 3 process improvements identified. Management and compliance teams briefed on incident and resolution.
